About Syed Bokhari

NDIS Behaviour Support Practitioner (Under Supervision)

Professional Background

Dedicated to Quality Behaviour Support

I am a Core-level behaviour support practitioner (under professional supervision), supporting NDIS participants, families, and provider teams in the development and implementation of Positive Behaviour Support strategies within appropriate governance arrangements.

NDIS Quality & Safeguards Commission - Alternate Pathway (Under Assessment)

Professional Experience

Experience supporting individuals with complex needs in disability services

Complex Support Experience

I have professional experience supporting individuals with complex psychosocial, behavioural, and functional needs within disability-related service and support environments. This work has involved:

  • Comprehensive assessment and identification of behaviour-related risks
  • Collaboration with participants, families, guardians, and providers
  • Person-centred, evidence-informed practice aligned with NDIS principles
  • Safeguarding considerations and least-restrictive practice approaches
  • Multidisciplinary collaboration and high-quality professional documentation

Behaviour Support Practice

Within my current scope, I contribute to behaviour support work under supervision, including:

  • Participation in functional assessment processes
  • Behaviour Support Plan (BSP) development support
  • Implementation support and coaching
  • Risk-informed and ethically grounded decision-making

My Practice Approach

Core principles guiding my behaviour support practice

üë§

Person-Centred

Respecting individual choice, dignity, and rights in all aspects of support

üß†

Trauma-Informed

Understanding and responding to the impact of trauma on behaviour and wellbeing

üìä

Evidence-Based

Using proven strategies and interventions supported by research

ü§ù

Collaborative

Working closely with families, providers, and multidisciplinary teams

üìã

Ethical Documentation

Clear, measurable goals and professional documentation standards

üîÑ

Reflective Practice

Continuous learning and improvement through supervision and self-reflection

Practice Experience Examples

Real examples of my contribution to behaviour support work under supervision

Assessment Support

Supporting information gathering and functional assessment processes under supervision, including stakeholder interviews and data collection

Plan Development

Contributing to the development and review of Behaviour Support Plans within registered provider arrangements

Implementation Support

Assisting with implementation planning and coaching for support teams and families

Risk Management

Identifying behaviour-related risks and contributing to safety and safeguarding discussions

Professional Development

Participating in reflective practice and supervision to support ethical decision-making

Focus of Support

üîÑ

Sustainable Practice

Supporting consistent, evidence-informed practice across settings

üéØ

Trigger Reduction

Reducing environmental and support-related triggers for behaviours of concern

Registration & Compliance

I practise within a clearly defined scope and am committed to transparency, ethical practice, and alignment with applicable NDIS Quality and Safeguards requirements. Registration status is stated clearly on this website and can be discussed with providers as required.

üìù Current Registration Status: Application currently under assessment by the NDIS Quality and Safeguards Commission (Alternate Pathway). Where services are delivered, they are delivered under supervision and through an appropriately registered organisation, in accordance with applicable NDIS requirements and governance arrangements. Independent delivery under my own NDIS registration will commence following approval.

Commitment to Compliance:

  • Transparent communication about registration status
  • Practice within clearly defined scope under supervision
  • Alignment with NDIS Quality and Safeguards requirements
  • Ethical practice and professional boundaries
  • Regular supervision and professional development
